its not on the ubuntu download page: ok i got the md5sum code... now what do i do make a txt file and put it in there with an extension .md5?

if you are running Linux already, open a terminal and type "md5sum FILE" where FILE is the file you downloaded.  That calculates the md5sum of the file.  If you are running Windows, search the web for a Windows program to do that.

Apparently, you put the md5 of the correct file in a file and execture "md5sum -c filename.md5" and it should calculate the md5sums of all the iso files.  You should also be able to just make it calculate the md5 of the file and compare it visually to the correct one.

the new image file would be a file on your hard drive.
